item.title: Julia
item.description: As I’m wrapping up my master’s degree, I have somehow managed to find a large amount of time to pursue personal interests. One of those interests is Julia, a technical computing language with C-comparable speed. I’m not exactly sure where I stumbled on it, but it stuck with me. Of course, the best way to learn something is to do something cool with it, and FiveThiryEight’s Riddler often tends to supply great cannon fodder for programming.

item.title: Github Pages
item.description: I recently moved my site away from zeit, and migrated it to GitHub Pages. It’s much easier to maintain the site with git than with zeit’s now feature, which is a little too high-powered for my tases. I’ve also changed the theme to a modified version of paperback. The colors were originally all sepia tone, and I liked the current color scheme and typography.

item.title: Introduction
item.description: Hello! I’ve just finished building this site with Hugo and blogdown, an excellent R package built up by the folks at RStudio. The first iteration of this site is being hosted by zeit, a super interesting cloud company. Deployment takes about a minute, unlike the absolute nightmare that is Google Cloud. They take Dockerfiles as well, something that I haven’t had any experience with until lately. As this is the first blog post here, I just thought I’d lay out a bit of why I built this.

item.title: About
item.description: I’m looking for work! If you need a financial analyst, data scientist, or just a quick learner, you can contact me at cpfiffer@gmail.com. I’m a graduate student in finance. I also play with code, and occasionally piano. This is a little website I built, partly as a portfolio of some of the stuff I can do, but also because it’s fun. I have a master’s in finance from the ICMA Centre at the Henley Business School (which itself is part of the University of Reading1) Nominally, my degree is in corporate finance, though I’ve studied most business disciplines.
